subject: Data
title: Standard Deviation: Measuring the Spread
description: A quick win: understand Standard Deviation: Measuring the Spread.

hook.text: Two classes both average 75% on a test. In one class everyone scores 70â€“80. In the other, 30â€“100.

buildup.text: The average alone hides a crucial detail: how spread out the data is. Standard deviation measures that spread.

discovery.text: A low standard deviation means data is clustered tightly. A high one means wild variation.

twist.text: Karl Pearson formalized it in the 1890s, giving scientists a universal way to describe data variability.

climax.text: Standard deviation is behind quality control, risk assessment, and grading curves worldwide.

punchline.text: The average never tells the whole story. The spread does.

quiz.question: What does standard deviation measure?
options: The middle value of a dataset
How spread out values are from the mean
The highest value minus the lowest
